data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: the smaller part of a group; less than half of the people or things in a large group

data.chText: 目前，只有极少数同学对政治感兴趣。
data.enText: Only a small minority of students is/are interested in politics these days.

data.chText: 少数派；少数民族；少数群体
data.enText: a small group within a community or country that is different because of race, religion, language, etc.

data.chText: 少数民族 / 族裔的权利
在国家东部一个人口众多的讲德语的少数民族
data.enText: a large German-speaking minority in the east of the country

data.chText: 这所学校里95%的学生来自少数族裔。
data.enText: The school is 95 per cent minority (= 95 per cent of children are not white Americans but from different groups) .
minority neighborhoods (= where no or few white people live)
the state of being under the age at which you are legally an adult
to form much less than half of a large group
be in a minority of one

data.chText: 是唯一持不同意见者；是唯一投此票者
data.enText: to be the only person to have a particular opinion or to vote a particular way
to form much less than half of a large group
be in a minority of one

data.chText: 是唯一持不同意见者；是唯一投此票者
data.enText: to be the only person to have a particular opinion or to vote a particular way

tr: being or relating to the smaller in number of two parts
example: when the vote was taken they were in the minority

tr: a group of people who differ racially or politically from a larger group of which it is a part
any age prior to the legal age

value.def: If you talk about a minority of people or things in a larger group, you are referring to a number of them that forms less than half of the larger group, usually much less than half.

example.ex: Local authority nursery provision covers only a tiny minority of working mothers...
example.tran: 当地政府提供的保育服务只有少数上班族母亲才能够享受到。

example.ex: These children are only a small minority.
example.tran: 这些孩子只是很少的一部分。

defx.def: If people are in a minority or in the minority, they belong to a group of people or things that form less than half of a larger group.

example.ex: Even in the 1960s, politically active students and academics were in a minority...
example.tran: 即使在20世纪60年代，热衷于政治的学生与大学教师也是少数。

example.ex: In the past conservatives have been in the minority.
example.tran: 过去保守派一直占少数。

value.def: A minority is a group of people of the same race, culture, or religion who live in a place where most of the people around them are of a different race, culture, or religion.

example.ex: Students have called for greater numbers of women and minorities on the faculty...
example.tran: 学生要求聘请更多女教师和少数民族族裔的老师。

example.ex: A final settlement must respect minority rights.
example.tran: 最终的解决方案必须尊重少数群体的权利。

trans: 少數派報告；少数者报告；少数派报告；关键报告；未来报告
(美国参议院和众议院中的)少数党领袖
